definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
yes (used by Emperor or ruler)/OK/to accede/to assent
intravenous infusion/to get put on an IV
to transfuse blood/to give aid and support
to imbue with/to inculcate/to instill into/to teach/to impart/to channel water to another place

pinyin: Shi2 you2 Shu1 chu1 guo2 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right

sentences.english: And those grownup who lose to a kid have the audacity to complaint?
sentences.chinese: 這些輸了的成年人還有臉抱怨？

sentences.english: Today play bullfight lose 1500 dollars depressing dead.
sentences.chinese: 今天打鬥牛輸啦1500塊錢鬱悶死了。
相反，猶他最近13場卻輸了10場。

sentences.english: He who does not hope to won has already lost.
sentences.chinese: 不希望贏得人已經輸了。

sentences.english: Hare:I am so full. I am going to lose.
sentences.chinese: 我喫得太飽了，我要輸了。

sentences.english: The quine[11] won by Europe, paid by France.
sentences.chinese: 是一場歐洲贏了法國輸了的賭博。

sentences.english: Jack fought John in the men 's singles last night and as beaten.
sentences.chinese: 傑克昨晚在男子單打比賽中與約翰相遇，結果輸了。

sentences.english: If you leave the competition now,people will think you're flinging up the sponge.
sentences.chinese: 如果你現在退出比賽，人人都會認爲你輸了。

sentences.english: Since he started trials at the age of one, he never lost one.
sentences.chinese: 從它一歲開始參賽起，它就沒有輸過一場比賽。

sentences.english: First, let me tell you that a trading plan is only useful if you foll …
sentences.chinese: 首先，讓我告訴你，如果你有用營運計劃只是輸後。

sentences.english: When inflexible rules are imposed on flexible humans, both sides lose.
sentences.chinese: 當死板的規則強加在靈活的人類身上時，兩面皆輸。

sentences.english: In the two years that followed, he was unbeatable in his regional go-kart events.
sentences.chinese: 隨後的兩年裏，在當地的卡丁車賽事中，他從未輸過。

sentences.english: Tmac just said that this loss is because of Yao's absence, and I agree.
sentences.chinese: 麥迪只是說這次輸了是因爲姚明不在，我同意他說的。

sentences.english: Today, I lost a bet with my brother and had to kiss his butt.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我和我弟弟打賭輸了，我得去親他的屁股。

sentences.english: Loser has to take out the trash for a month.
sentences.chinese: 輸的人罰倒垃圾一個月。

sentences.english: We won at volley-ball but lost at tennis.
sentences.chinese: 我們排球贏了，但網球輸了。

definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
